abstract.original_text: Existing knowledge about these common illnesses relies on research conducted before the rapid developments in molecular diagnostics of recent decades or focusses on disease at the severe end of the spectrum -hospitalisations -affecting a limited number of children and discounting the burden of more common, but less severe, community-managed illness.

abstract.original_text: This protocol outlines a dynamic birth cohort study that will allow for a detailed description of the epidemiology of respiratory and gastrointestinal viruses during the first two years of life.

abstract.original_text: The large biobank of specimens to be collated will act as a rich source of material to answer targeted research questions, including the role of virus acquisition and shedding on clinical illness and the discovery of new infectious agents.
